revision.text:
{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = Killer Wireless-AC NIC 1420 |caption2 = |pp = http://www.killernetworking.com/technology/killer-double-shot-pro |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = Rivet Networks |model = Killer Wireless-AC NIC 1420 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = October 21, 2013 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Rivet_Networks_Killer_Wireless-AC_NIC_1420 |sernum = |wlclass = AC1200 |series = |if = Mini PCIe |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = (half) |vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 003c |subvendor_id = 1a56 |subdevice_id = 1420 |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = |icid = |us_id = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 0C:84:DC, 1C:3E:84 |chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9862; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |acqam = |802.11ac = 867 |nqam = |802.11n = 300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = bluetooth |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 2013 |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B06WD4R2KG |asin_country = JP |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== {{see also|Rivet Networks}} ===General notes=== This device seems to have been or will be sold w/ some '''Alienware''' CTO machines @ '''Dell''' in Europe and other non-US regions. :The full tag line w/ an '''Alienware''' order was ''Killer NIC 1420 802.11n/ac WiFi and Bluetooth 4.0 (SAF)''. There is scant mention of this card anywhere on the net, but.. *it's usage of the QCA988x/986x PCI ID per [http://www.magicdriver.com/driver93964-ver_11.0.4.27.html this driver] (ak14w7 / ak14w7x [x64] named files) *probable half-sized Mini Card form factor, other options for the 2013 '''Alienware''' models look to be mPCIe based, M.2/NGFF expansion seems to be absent (though present in the newest models using the AC1525) *reference on a few far-east trading sites as the QCWB342 ([http://web.archive.org/web/20150130201718/http://itempage3.auction.co.kr/DetailView.aspx?itemno=B200495599 auction.co.kr], [http://web.archive.org/web/20150130201814/http://item.taobao.com/item.htm?id=40806453288 taobao]) - ''Lite-On'' manufacture ... indicate this card was most likely the [[Qualcomm Atheros QCWB342|QCWB342]] (WB342 reference design, QCA9862 based). However, a M.2/NGFF reference design for the QCA9862 does also exist ([[Qualcomm Atheros QCNFA342|NFA342]]) and also seems to be tersely labeled as a '''Killer Wireless 1420'''. With that noted, *[http://fccid.net/business.php?id=PPD It doesn't appear to have passed through the FCC]. *It's visible here @ [http://web.archive.org/web/20150130200917/http://cart100.com/Product/36911525410/ cart100.com] and [http://web.archive.org/web/20150130201410/http://item.taobao.com/item.htm?id=36911525410 taobao] (both by the same seller). **The card is silkscreened with '''QUALCOMM ATHEROS''', ('''QCABNFA1420A''' + '''Y5375''' or '''NFA342''' + '''250-02460-030'''). *The card sold on Amazon (JP) is tersely labeled as a '''Killer™ Wirelss-N1420NGFF'''. **The back of the card is silkscreened with a Foxconn P/N of T77H476. Both cards (.. and likely any other QCA988x/986x devices using 168c:003c PCI ID) will identify as a Killer AC 1420 from within Windows using QCA's Killer driver. It's possible both '''WB342 / NFA342''' reference design cards were sold as the '''Killer Wireless 1420''', but it's not known with certainty. ===Entry specific notes=== The OUIs in this entry are certainly derived from T77H476 (or other Foxconn manufactured) units, however, it is not known where the PCI subsystem was sourced from. ==Links of Interest== ===Forum threads=== *[http://www.compex.com.sg:809/forum/topic.asp?whichpage=1&TOPicid=2416 Discussion on the Compex forums regarding the Killer driver] :[http://downloads.dell.com/FOLDER01573133M/2/WiFi_BT_QCA_Killer1202_Win84_A03_Setup-KM22Y_ZPE.exe '''Dell''' / '''Alienware''' driver set linked on that thread] ==Notes== ===Serial info=== ====lspci/lsusb==== {{SCollapse| '''lspci''' on ubuntu 16.04 |
03:00.0 Network controller: Qualcomm Atheros QCA986x/988x 802.11ac Wireless Network Adapter
	Subsystem: Bigfoot Networks, Inc. QCA986x/988x 802.11ac Wireless Network Adapter
	Physical Slot: 1
	Control: I/O- Mem+ BusMaster+ SpecCycle- MemWINV- VGASnoop- ParErr- Stepping- SERR- FastB2B- DisINTx+
	Status: Cap+ 66MHz- UDF- FastB2B- ParErr- DEVSEL=fast >TAbort- SERR- }}

		 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * P2P-device: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0

		 * IBSS: 0x40 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * managed: 0x40 0xd0
		 * AP: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * mesh point: 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * P2P-client: 0x40 0xd0
		 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * P2P-device: 0x40 0xd0
	software interface modes (can always be added):
		 * AP/VLAN
		 * monitor
	valid interface combinations:
		 * #{ AP, mesh point } <= 8, #{ managed } <= 1,
		   total <= 8, #channels <= 1, STA/AP BI must match
	HT Capability overrides:
		 * MCS: ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff
		 * maximum A-MSDU length
		 * supported channel width
		 * short GI for 40 MHz
		 * max A-MPDU length exponent
		 * min MPDU start spacing
	Device supports TX status socket option.
	Device supports HT-IBSS.
	Device supports SAE with AUTHENTICATE command
	Device supports scan flush.
	Device supports AP scan.
	Device supports per-vif TX power setting
	Driver supports full state transitions for AP/GO clients
	Driver supports a userspace MPM
	Driver/device bandwidth changes during BSS lifetime (AP/GO mode)
	Device supports static SMPS
	Device supports configuring vdev MAC-addr on create.
	Device supports VHT-IBSS.

}}
